content.post_text_preview:
Today, Florida banned H-1B hiring at state universities. The policy announcement cited examples like "assistant swim coach from Spain" and "clinical professor from West Bank," asking: "Can't we produce these ourselves?"

Fair question. Wrong solution.

This decision traces back to a viral thread from December 2024 that analyzed 900,000 H-1B records and shaped the immigration debate for months. The thread was methodologically solid, used real data, and got millions of views.

There's just one problem: it analyzed Labor Condition Applications (LCAs), not actual H-1B visas...

carousel_slides.alt_text: Title slide: The H-1B Data Everyone Got Wrong. A viral thread fooled millions. Here's what the numbers actually show.
Funnel chart showing LCA Certifications vs Actual H-1B Approvals. 900,000 DOL LCA certifications narrowing down to 400,000 USCIS H-1B approvals through 4 reduction steps. Ratio: 2.25:1
Pie chart: H-1B Approvals New vs Renewals FY 2024. 35% new employment (141,000) and 65% continuing employment (259,000). Total: 400,000 approvals. Only NEW employment counts toward 85k cap.

Bar chart: IT Staffing Firms - The Low-Wage H-1B Tier. Shows Cognizant (93,000 applications, $90k), Infosys (61,000, $88k), TCS (60,000, $85k), Wipro (40,000, $87k), and Capgemini (30,000, $92k). 5-year totals. 95%+ Indian workers, contract model.

Bar chart: Tech Giants - The High-Wage H-1B Tier. Shows Amazon (10,044 approvals, $300k+), Microsoft (5,189, $320k+), Meta (5,123, $380k+), Apple (4,202, $350k+), and Google (4,181, $360k+). FY 2025 data. 30-50% Indian workers, direct employees with equity.

India Green Card Backlog: The 140-Year Crisis. Shows three EB categories: EB-1 (24,148 people, 2.7 year wait), EB-2 (853,705 people, 140 YEAR wait), EB-3 (262,792 people, 140 YEAR wait). Total: 1.1M+ Indians waiting. Per-country cap creates generational trap.

Evidence-Based Reforms slide with three checkmarked items: Remove per-country caps (clear backlog in 8-10 years), Wage-based selection (prioritize high-skill positions), Separate IT staffing tier (address low-wage concerns). Full analysis with 45+ sources. Follow for data-driven policy insights.
